availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James B. Latimer (Baltimore County, Maryland, lawyer, commissioner of deeds, and notary public)

body.p: Baltimore, Maryland, attorney and commissioner of deeds. Maryland native. Attorney in Baltimore in 1860. Employed Bridget McIntire and Mary McIntire as servants in Baltimore in 1860. Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky in Baltimore from 1861 through 1866.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore Ward 10, p. 961.
E.M. Cross's and Co.'s Baltimore City Business Directory for 1863-1864 ed. Henry R. Hellier (Baltimore, Maryland: E. M. Cross & Co. Publishers, 1863), 448.
Woods' Baltimore City Directory for 1865-1866 ed. John W. Woods (Baltimore, Maryland: John W. Woods, 1865), 247.
KYR-0001-017-0383
